xml:
Symbicort 100/6 Turbohaler<tm tmtype="reg"/> Indications and dose

Asthma, maintenance therapy

By inhalation of powder

  • Child 6–17 years

    Initially 1–2 puffs twice daily; reduced to 1 puff daily, dose reduced only if control is maintained.

  • Adult

    Initially 1–2 puffs twice daily, increased if necessary up to 4 puffs twice daily; reduced to 1 puff daily, dose reduced only if control is maintained.

Asthma, maintenance and reliever therapy

By inhalation of powder

  • Adult

    Maintenance 2 puffs daily in 1–2 divided doses; 1 puff as required for relief of symptoms, increased if necessary up to 6 puffs as required, up to 12 puffs daily can be used for a limited time but medical assessment should be considered; maximum 8 puffs per day.

 Unlicensed use

When used by inhalation in children

Symbicort not licensed for use in children for asthma maintenance and reliever therapy.
Clinical medicinal product information Clinical medicinal product information
